page.title: 09Animal Rearing At Mulben
page.content: Until about twenty years ago, you would only see black cattle on the farms in this area. These were Aberdeen Angus, or a cross between aberdeen Angus and other breeds. But now there are many new breeds of cattle kept by the farmers and you see very few black cattle. There is a Market in Keith every Tuesday for cattle being sold to the butcher. Once a month, on a Monday, there is a Market for one_year_old animals. Farmers in this area sell most of their beasts as one_year_olds.They are bought by farmers from places where the grass and climate are better for fattening cattle. Farmers from the Mulben area also sell beasts at Markets in Huntly, Elgin and Aberdeen.
